name: Quesadilla Burgers
author: KitchenWitch
summary: This is a great twist on the hamburger that everyone is sure to love! It's a combination of southwest and the classic American hamburger. I have three kids who all eat very differently from one another and this was a hit for them as well as hubby! I like to serve these with either sweet potato fries or green bean fries!
ingredients: 1 dash Worcestershire sauce, or to taste
½ head lettuce, shredded, or to taste
3 tablespoons picante sauce, or to taste
directions: Mix sour cream, ranch dressing, and taco sauce together in a bowl until Southwest sauce is smooth
Cover bowl and refrigerate for flavors to blend
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate
Cook hamburger patties in the preheated grill for 5 minutes, seasoning with Worcestershire sauce
Arrange tortillas on the grill and lower heat to medium-low under tortillas
Add Cheddar cheese and Colby-Jack cheese to tortillas; cook until cheeses melt, 2 to 4 minutes
Continue cooking hamburger patties until cooked through, about 5 minutes more
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C)
Spread Southwest sauce onto 1/2 of the tortillas; top with lettuce and picante sauce
Place 1 hamburger patty on top of picante sauce layer and top patty with a tortilla, creating a sandwich
